00001 #ifndef APTTOOL_H
00002 #define APTTOOL_H
00003 
00004 typedef double angleDegrees; //angle in degrees
00005 
00006 /*class APTtool
00007 ** this generates a tool profile from the classic APT tool description (image
00008 ** at http://www.anderswallin.net/2008/02/z-map-model-for-3-axis-machining/ )
00009 ** r= major radius, b=minor radius, A=tip angle from perpendicular (WRT tool
00010 ** axis), a=dist from tool axis to center of minor radius, B=side angle from
00011 ** parallel, h = height of tool 
00012 ** profile will be on the XZ plane, symmeteric about Z, the center of the
00013 **  tool's tip will be at the origin, rest of the tool above (+Z) the origin
00014 ** always: a+b <= r, A<90,A+B<=90
00015 ** standard cylindrical: b=0,a=r,A=0,B=0
00016 ** ball nose: b=r,a=r/2,A=0,B=0
00017 ** etc
00018 ** corner-rounding tools CANNOT be defined with this method, unfortunately
00019 */
00020 class APTtool {
00021   private:
00022     typedef enum { BALLNOSE,  CYLINDRICAL, TOROIDAL, ENGRAVING,
00023                    TAPERED,     OTHER,     UNDEFINED            } SHAPE_TYPE;
00024     SHAPE_TYPE shapeType;
00025     TopoDS_Face profile;
00026     double r,a,b, h;
00027     angleDegrees A,B;
00028     bool valid;
00029     void classify();
00030     void generate();
00031   protected:
00032     void failure();
00033   public:
00034     APTtool(double rr, double hh); //ballnose
00035     APTtool(double rr,double aa,double bb,
00036             angleDegrees AA,angleDegrees BB, double hh);
00037     const bool isValid() {return valid;};
00038     const SHAPE_TYPE getType() {return shapeType;};
00039     const TopoDS_Face getProfile() {return profile;};
00040 };
00041 
00042 #endif //APTTOOL_H
